original: It puts the ball in the net or it gets the hose again. Absolutely amazing, have nothing negative to say about this game as it's exceeded my expectations and will probably exeed yours too. Fluid movement, bug/crash free, lots of story/content to put you through, options for each and every day such as multiple practices, events (sponsorships) and even games. This review is purely based on playing mycareer, and so far it's 10/10. Facescan worked really well for me (used it two times, first one made me have a downsyndrome forehead though..). Keep in mind, using the mynba2k17 app will allow for you to facescan for free and allow you to earn daily vc. #sellout
polished: It puts the ball in the net or it gets the hose again. Absolutely amazing, I have nothing negative to say about this game as it exceeds my expectations and will probably exceed yours too. The fluid movement, bug-free, and lots of story/content to put you through options for each and every day, such as multiple practices, events, and even games. This review is based on playing my career, and so far, it's 10/10. The Facescan worked really well for me (I used it twice, the first one made me have a downward-facing forehead, though). Keep in mind that using the My NBA 2K17 app will allow you to Facescan for free and earn daily VC. #Sellout.

original: Magic fans beware... Wizards is afraid to make a decent digital game. At its core magic the gathering is a social game. A game to enjoy with your friends (or frenemies) laughing, talking smack, and dropping game winning bombs. Wizards of the coast seems to have forgotten this. If you choose to play with friends you cant earn gold, and gold is important. Gold is so important that they have implemented a daily cap, understandable considering gold unlocks everything in game. But get ready for a long and boring 1v1 grind against the computer or random oponents, whom you can't even speak to. If you choose to play for free, it will take you roughly 4 hours a day for upwards of a month, by yourself, to unlock the cards.
polished: Magic fans, beware... Wizards are hesitant to create a decent digital game. At its core, the gathering is a social game. A game to enjoy with friends (or frenemies) laughing, talking smack, and dropping game-winning bombs. The wizards of the coast seem to have forgotten this. If you choose to play with friends, you can earn gold, and gold is crucial. Gold is so important that they have implemented a daily cap, understandably considering gold unlocks everything in the game. But get ready for a long and tedious 1v1 grind against the computer or random opponents, whom you can't even communicate with. If you choose to play for free, it will take you roughly 4 hours a day for upwards of a month, by yourself, to unlock the cards.

original: Being the 3rd installment in the trilogy i'll get the bad stuff out of the way first. I quite hate pre-quals as it's technically going backwards in a story and not forwards (this is an issue for every pre-qual). Granted it offers more storywise. The combat feels sloppy and doesn't feel as sharp as arkham city managed to make it. As of writing this recommendation (26/10/2013) there is a game breaking bug that stops a side mission from ever being completed (main story not effected). Some gadgets are put at a rediculous hotkey that makes your hand have to travel the whole keyboard to get to it. It might sound like nothing, but while in combat it could potentially break your combo.
polished: I'll tackle the unpleasant aspects first in the third installment of the trilogy. I strongly dislike pre-quals as they take the story backward, rather than forward (this is a problem common to all pre-quals). While they do provide more story, the combat feels sloppy and lacks the sharpness that Arkham City managed to achieve. As of my writing this review (October 26, 2013), there is a game-breaking bug that prevents a side mission from ever being completed (the main story remains unaffected). Some gadgets are placed at an inconvenient hotkey that requires a lengthy keyboard journey to access, which may seem minor, but in combat, it could potentially disrupt your combos.

original: They basically fixed shadow warrior (2013) i.e. The bossfights are awesome, weapons feel very nice (maybe not as good as d44m's ones, but still solid), enemies aren't too spongy (if you're not too much of a retard with handling elemental and upgrade stuff). The upgrade system is really balanced and once you get around it, it's not too tedious. The elemental stuff and limited ammo softly forces you to use different weapons. Lots of cool unique (being the important word here while comparing sw2 to ♥♥♥♥♥♥ borderlands' formula of 'rng' weapons) weapons that stay viable through most of the game. The music is great, especially the main theme and of course stan bush's stuff.
polished: They have effectively resolved the Shadow Warrior (2013) issue, i.e., the boss fights are impressive, weapons feel very nice (albeit not as exceptional as D44M's, but still solid), enemies aren't too spongy (if you're not too reckless with handling elemental and upgrade items). The upgrade system is well-balanced and once you master it, it's not overly tedious. The elemental elements and limited ammo encourage you to use a variety of weapons. Many unique, or rather, cool weapons that remain viable throughout most of the game. The music is excellent, particularly the main theme and, of course, Stan Bush's work.

original: So many things was made wrong. I even dont know how to start this review. This all is refered to mycareer. My player is an outside scorer, pg, 1.71m, has maxed stats and got already all necessary perks. Ok, and now tell me, why the shooting skill depends to a person's hight? why a person who has 1.74m can not became so good in shooting as a person with 1.71m? i'm 1.87m in rl, made my first player with this hight and noticed then i can not reach a higher skill than 89. Why? thats a pure discrimination! and why the game does not tell me that before i create a char and not even then when i reach the skill limit after weeks of playing?!?
polished: So many things went wrong. I'm having trouble starting this review, as it's all related to my career. My player is an outside scorer, PG, 1.71m, with maxed stats and all necessary perks. Okay, and now I'd like to know, why the shooting skill depends on a person's height. Why a person with 1.74m can't become as good in shooting as someone with 1.71m? As an 1.87m player in RL, I created my first player with this height and noticed that I couldn't reach a higher skill than 89. Why is that a clear discrimination? And why the game doesn't inform me of this before I create a character, and not even then when I reach the skill limit after weeks of playing?

original: I think this assassin's creed nailed the mechanics down on all fronts (ship battles, sailing, hunting (fish), parkour, etc). I felt much more attached to this character as well. The story starts out extremely rough but does get much much better as you play (i think this is with every ac game personally). Edward was quite the interesting character and so was all the side characters. I felt like all the collectables actually meant something in this ac game that i never got from any of the previous ones and maybe its because i felt like they had a bigger purpose in the game. They def were not required but they were fun to get and you got rewarded in a very balanced way.
polished: I think this assassin's creed nailed the mechanics on all fronts, from ship battles to sailing, hunting, parkour, and more. I felt a strong attachment to this character as well. The story starts out rough, but it gets much better as you play. Edward was an interesting character, and so were all the side characters. I felt that all the collectibles actually had a purpose in this game, which I never got from any of the previous ones. Perhaps it's because I felt like they had a bigger role in the game. They were not required, but they were fun to get and you got rewarded in a well-balanced way.

original: While i personally cannot recommend this game, it wasn't absolutely terrible. The gunplay is alright, so long as you have the money to purchase gun parts, which would be my main complaint with this game: it's pay-to-win. If i could get past that, the game would be enjoyable, as the hardsuit is fun to use and hrv is an excellent idea. I'd take this game over any call of duty title any day, but its pay-to-win microtransanction format is off-putting for me. If you are alright with this model, then by all means, have fun. But if you're like me and dislike pay-to-win games, just let this one slide; it's not our cup of tea.
polished: While I personally cannot recommend this game, it wasn't absolutely terrible. The gunplay is alright, as long as you have the budget to purchase gun parts, which would be my main concern with this game  it's pay-to-win. If I could look past that, the game would be enjoyable, as the hard suit is fun to use and HRV is an excellent idea. I'd take this game over any Call of Duty title any day, but its pay-to-win microtransaction format is off-putting for me. If you're alright with this model, then by all means, have fun. But if you're like me and dislike pay-to-win games, just let this one slide; it's not our cup of tea.

original: While not perfect, this game has been greatly enjoyable. The save system and possibility of sudden death leads to some frustration. I'm on my first playthrough and i lost my main character around hour 10 of 20ish. Would have really liked a save to reload at that point. I've since picked up a 3rd party mod/save tool to avoid catastrophic failures. Plus the aiming reticule is on the small side and zoom is underpowered. With all that said, its been a blast. I'm not normally a zombie fan, but the combination of strategy, missions, first person shooter/beat em up is great. I've been playing it as often as i can get away... Just one more mission, just one more supply run - or i'm running away and want to get safe before shutting the game down.
polished: While not perfect, this game has been a thoroughly enjoyable experience. The save system and possibility of sudden death can lead to some frustration. I'm currently on my first playthrough and I lost my main character around hour 10 of the 20-hour mark. I would have greatly appreciated the ability to reload at that point. I've since acquired a third-party mod/save tool to avoid catastrophic failures. Additionally, the aiming reticle is a bit small and the zoom could be more powerful. With all that said, it's been a blast. I'm not typically a fan of zombies, but the combination of strategy, missions, and first-person shooter/beat 'em up is a great combination. I've been playing it as often as I can get away... Just one more mission, just one more supply run - or I'm running away and want to get to a safe location before shutting the game down.

original: An absolute great stragtegy game! having played every single other wargame (european escalation, and alb), i have to say this one fits well. The number of units are great. Not sure exactly how many units there are, but there's a crap ton!!! graphics are just beautiful, sounds are great, and the gameplay overall is epic. The ingame chat box at the main menu is very entertaining as well, no i am not kidding. However, if anyone thinking this game is 'easy', or if you are new to the strategy genre, it could take you quite some time to get it nailed down. Do not get upset, you will lose a lot of units. Just make sure you plan ahead, always have anti-air, and anti-tank.
polished: This game is an absolute great strategy game! Having played every single other war game (European Escalation and Albion), I have to say this one fits well. The number of units is great. Not sure exactly how many units there are, but there's a vast amount. The graphics are just beautiful, the sounds are great, and the gameplay overall is epic. The in-game chat box at the main menu is very entertaining, I'm not kidding. However, if you think this game is 'easy', or if you're new to the strategy genre, it could take you some time to get it down. Don't get discouraged, you'll lose a lot of units. Just make sure you plan ahead, always have anti-air, and anti-tank.

original: I was negatively biased towards this game before i played it. Wasn't even sure about buying. I dunno, the whole portal gun and portals thing seemed weird to me even though i like science fiction. Boy was i wrong. The jokes and voice acting in this game is phenomenal. Just amazing. It's not cheesy (ok it's sometimes cheesy). And different story characters have all their own sense of humour. Those different characters do really have different personalities. And the level design; it's just rad. Btw i never played the first portal game. One of these days, i'm planning to if i can spare the time. I would never have played it if i hadn't played the sequel.
polished: I was initially skeptical about this game before I played it. I wasn't even sure about buying it, as the whole portal gun and portals concept seemed unusual to me, even though I enjoy science fiction. I was wrong. The humor and voice acting in this game are phenomenal. They're not cheesy, although it's occasionally cheesy. Each of the story's characters has their own distinct sense of humor. The different characters truly have distinct personalities. The level design is just fantastic. By the way, I never played the first Portal game. One of these days, I'm planning to play it if I can spare the time. I wouldn't have played it if I hadn't played the sequel.

original: Ok lets start on the pros(+) and cons(-) then my thoughts on this game. +some of the best charecters +good story +lods of content +customisible charecter ( you can be male or female whatever you like) +you can have a relationship with most of your companions(yes fangirls you can have a love intrest) -bad graphics ( i dont think graphics really matter anyway) -weird and akward love scenes -invisible walls -theirs one mission in my opinion was boring but everyone has different tastes -+ um this isnt really bad or good but for those who care your protaginist you made cant talk okay know for my thoughts. I love this game. This game is probubly one of the best rpgs or games in general i have ever played.so if your a rpg fan you proubly already have this game.
polished: Let's begin by weighing the pros and cons of this game. The positives include some of the best characters, a good story, a vast amount of content, customizable characters (you can choose to play as male or female), and the ability to form relationships with most companions, including romantic interests. On the negative side, the graphics are subpar, although I personally don't think they're a major issue. Additionally, some of the love scenes can be awkward and feel out of place, and there are instances of invisible walls and a somewhat dull mission that may not resonate with everyone. One aspect that's neither good nor bad is the inability of your protagonist to speak, which may be a consideration for some players. In my opinion, I thoroughly enjoy this game. It's likely one of the best RPGs or games I've ever played, and if you're a fan of RPGs, you probably already own this game.

original: Yes, this is a nostalgia trip for thirty-somethings who remember (at least in the uk) watching the ever-irritating timmy mallet just for the five minute transformers cartoon. The voice actors for optimus, megatron, bumblebee, and many others are back, and instantly recognisable. The distinctive cartoon transformation sound is there. Graphically, the cell-shaded presentation is perfect, and very, very generation one. But aside from that, it's actually a very fun game. The combat mechanics are extremely well done. Transforming mid-fight is often a necessity, and woven seamlessly into combos, making it quite unlike high moon's excellent war for/fall of cybertron games. Another distinction is the heavy focus on melee combat, but some enemies (e.g. Seekers) require a switch to a ranged blaster.
polished: Yes, this is a nostalgia trip for thirty-somethings who remember watching the ever-irksome Timmy Mallet for the five-minute Transformers cartoon. The voice actors for Optimus, Megatron, Bumblebee, and many others are back, and instantly recognizable. The distinctive cartoon transformation sound effects are there. Graphically, the cell-shaded presentation is perfect, and very, very Generation One. But aside from that, it's actually a very fun game. The combat mechanics are extremely well-done. Transforming mid-fight is often a necessity, and seamlessly woven into combos, making it quite unlike the excellent War for Cybertron games. Another distinction is the heavy focus on melee combat, but some enemies (e.g., Seekers) require a switch to a ranged blaster.

original: So i downloaded the game and played it for a little while, and it was nothing special. I spent more time trying to log in though than actually playing the game. There is a bug where it says that there was an update to the terms of service or whatever and whenever you clicked 'accept' it would just pop up again. You have to restart the client for it to work. Now that isn't that bad but why do i need to link my steam and gface accounts? they say it is for dlc but why is that even necessary? it is also not reversable so now i know that a company i don't care about has access to my steam information. Now the game itself is so so. It is easily recognisable as a cod clone, except somehow they made the gunplay worse... How is that even possible?
polished: I downloaded the game and played it for a bit, but it was underwhelming. I spent more time trying to log in than actually playing the game. There's a bug where it prompts you to update the terms of service, but clicking 'accept' doesn't work, so you have to restart the client. That's not ideal, but what I find concerning is that I'm forced to link my Steam and GFACE accounts. They claim it's for DLC, but I'm not sure why that's necessary, especially since it's not reversible. Now I know that a company I don't care about has access to my Steam information. The game itself is somewhat disappointing. It's easily recognizable as a Call of Duty clone, but somehow they managed to make the gunplay worse. It's hard to fathom how they achieved that.

original: 4k+ at 60fps (gtx 970), dual audio options and includes neptune gear. What's not to love? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nygsb617tmo excellent port and a great entry point if new to the series. Just keep in mind there is lots of (skip-able) talking. As usual would suggest using a gamepad but personally i had no problems with a keymouse/mouse setup, both completely rebindable. Price is about right and wouldn't have been unhappy about a purchase. More then half the dlc is included free, which is still plenty to play with. Recommended game to all jrpg/anime/visualnovel fans, provided you don't mind long breaks between the action. Cheers. No commentary playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=plslfvijaupszez9af395mvnk63xnhsj1_
polished: 4K+ at 60fps (GTX 970) and dual audio options, along with Neptune Gear, make for a fantastic experience. What's not to love? (Check out the excellent port in this YouTube video  https //www.youtube.com/watch?v=nygsb617tmo.) This game is a great entry point for newcomers to the series. Keep in mind that there is some (skippable) dialogue. As usual, I recommend using a gamepad, but I had no issues with a keyboard-mouse setup, which is fully rebindable. The price is reasonable, and I wouldn't have been disappointed with a purchase. Plus, more than half the DLC is included for free, providing plenty to play with. I highly recommend this game to JRPG, anime, and visual novel fans, as long as you're comfortable with occasional breaks between action sequences. Cheers. (No commentary playlist available here  https //www.youtube.com/playlist?list=plslfvijaupszez9af395mvnk63xnhsj1.)

original: I experienced no performance problems even at release, and after all these patches it plays really well. Imo, this is a really great and fun game in truth, although the format may be somewhat annoying (where the free-roam city area repopulates with new enemies every time you progress the story). I particularly enjoyed the 'dual play' segments (where you can play batman + 1 more), and the ability to use the controller for most segments of the game but the mouse and keyboard for the tank combat segments was greatly appreciated. Driving your batmobile around the free-roam city, including when chasing the apc commanders, is actually quite enjoyable once you figure out how to use the breaks to skid around corners (and when you master that, driving around the city is really quite enjoyable!)
polished: I experienced no performance issues at release, and after all these patches, the game plays really well. In my opinion, this is a truly great and fun game, although the format may be somewhat annoying (where the free-roam city area repopulates with new enemies every time you progress the story). I particularly enjoyed the 'dual play' segments, where you can play Batman alongside one more character, and the ability to use the controller for most parts of the game, but the mouse and keyboard for the tank combat segments was greatly appreciated. Driving the Batmobile around the free-roam city, including when chasing the APC commanders, is actually quite enjoyable once you master the art of using the breaks to skid around corners, and when you master that, driving around the city is really quite enjoyable.

original: Damn fine aaa fps shooter - that's the bottom line. It's looks, sounds and plays great - great fps mechanics, nice story, cool characters, flawless voice acting, and a badass soundtrack. Not for the faint hearted though - some of those cutscenes were pretty darn cruel and vivid. But when a game overall is so great, it's easier to spot the flaws, and here they are as i saw 'em: - no sli support - wtf? i had to put the game away until i upgraded my card, as it ran too poorly on my old dual gpu gtx 590. Make sure you have a fairly decent single gpu card. - stupidly small obstacles are often unclimbable.
polished: Overall, the game is a fantastic FPS shooter. The graphics, sound, and gameplay are all top-notch - great mechanics, engaging story, memorable characters, and a fantastic voice acting, along with a killer soundtrack. However, it's not for the faint of heart, as some of the cutscenes can be quite graphic and intense. Despite this, it's hard to overlook the flaws when the game is this good, and I noticed a few issues  no SLI support, which made the game run poorly on my old dual-GPU GTX 590. Make sure to have a decent single-GPU card to play this game smoothly.

original: English is not my native language. I am dutch. So please ignore any typing/grammatical mistakes in my review of this fantastic game. I will break down this review in a few categories: - graphics - controls - sound - gameplay - replayability - graphics: the game has been set in a comic-like style. The graphics are very slick: no unnecussery details. Nice colour-scemes. It totally works for this game. The graphics can be set on 'high' without stressing your system. I run this game on an i5 pentium processor, with nvidia geforce 710m card - 8gb memory and it runs like clockwork (windows 8.1). - controls: the game can be played with keyboard and mouse, but also with an x-box controller.
polished: Although English is not my native language, I'm Dutch, so please bear with any minor typing or grammatical mistakes in my review of this fantastic game. I will break down this review into several categories  graphics, controls, sound, and replayability. Graphics  the game features a comic-like style, with very slick and detailed visuals. The graphics can be set to 'high' without putting a strain on your system. I run this game on an i5 Pentium processor with an NVIDIA GeForce 710M card, 8GB of memory, and Windows 8.1, and it runs smoothly. Controls  the game can be played with a keyboard and mouse, but it's also compatible with an Xbox controller.

original: You can see by the hours i put into this game that i enjoy it. This is everything i wished a search game from cod would be. But dont buy this game thinking its like cod, battlefield, or any other shooter game. Its a game in its own class and should be treated as such. Cant tell you how many times i hear new players ♥♥♥♥♥ and complain about getting killed really fast. Oh god forbid you get shot in the face and ♥♥♥♥ing die. It's not like that doents happen in real life or anything. Edit:ok so ive been playing this game for awhile now. Thrown all kinds of money at it. One of the best mp games around. A good thing to play when your your not feeling cs:go.
polished: You can see the hours I've put into this game, and it's clear that I thoroughly enjoy it. This is everything I wished a search game from Cod would be. However, I wouldn't recommend buying this game thinking it's like Cod, Battlefield, or any other shooter game. It's a game in its own class and should be treated as such. I've heard countless times from new players complaining about getting killed quickly, and it's frustrating to hear them say, "Oh no, I just got shot in the face and died." It's not like that happens in real life, and it's not realistic. After playing this game for a while, I can confidently say it's one of the best multiplayer games around. It's a great option to play when you're not in the mood for CS GO.

original: I'm 2 hours in and am dying from this game. So funny. Gameplay is also solid, art design is beautiful, music is surprisingly high quality and appropriate, the story/world has me interested, and the puzzles are fun. But the best thing about this game beyond all that is the comedy. If you've played any rpg since the dawn of video game rpgs you will laugh at the various jokes, parodies, and references; if you've never played an rpg before then you should still enjoy the game for its humor. If you played final fantasy 7 or x you absolutely need to play this game, without giving too much away... I had to actually stop playing after 2 hours to give my cheeks a break from laughing and smiling so much. What a delight so far.
polished: I'm two hours into this game and I'm dying from laughter. The gameplay is solid, the art design is beautiful, the music is surprisingly high-quality and fitting, and the story/world has me hooked. But the best part about this game is the comedy. If you've played any RPGs since the dawn of video game RPGs, you'll laugh at the various jokes, parodies, and references; if you've never played an RPG before, you'll still enjoy the game for its humor. If you played Final Fantasy 7 or X, you absolutely need to play this game, without giving away too much... I had to stop playing after two hours to give my cheeks a break from laughing and smiling so much. What a delight so far.

original: I'm really sorry, i try to be supportive of free-to-play games and indie developers, but i really didn't enjoy this game. The description sounded right up my alley, but the execution has done nothing for me. I love puzzle and exploration games, but i found this game to be completely unintuitive, and even after looking up how to progress i still just simply didn't find the gameplay itself fun. It also completely lacks a pause button, or if it does have one i never found it. Considering that a lot of sequences in the game are timed, this seems like a critical oversight. I also feel like this game is a lot more cut scene than it is game, and i end up just sitting around drumming my fingers a lot.
polished: I'm truly sorry to say, but I tried to be supportive of free-to-play games and indie developers, but I didn't really enjoy this game. The description sounded right up my alley, but the execution fell short of my expectations. I love puzzle and exploration games, but I found this game to be completely unintuitive, and even after looking up how to progress, I still didn't find the gameplay itself enjoyable. It also lacks a pause button, or if it does have one, I never found it. Considering that a lot of sequences in the game are timed, this seems like a critical oversight. I also feel like this game is a lot more cutscene than it is game, and I end up just sitting around drumming my fingers a lot.

original: This game.... Phew where to even start. It was absolutely beautiful, from story to graphics i was hooked. The story wasnt just some story but actually felt like i was that person, trying to figure out what came next in the story that my character was telling. Gameplay was great and i learned alot about myself through this game (mainly my fear of hights which i never had a problem with until the ice caverns). My gut churned the whole time, but i kept through for uncle fred! if you guys made a dlc or second game, i would be the first to buy it and recomend it to everyone i know. Thanks to everyone who was involved making this, you made a absolutely beautiful game.
polished: This game was an absolute delight from start to finish. It was a truly captivating experience, from the story to the graphics, I was completely hooked. The story wasn't just a narrative, but it felt like I was the protagonist, trying to figure out what came next in the story that my character was sharing. Gameplay was excellent, and I learned a lot about myself through this game (mainly about my fear of heights, which I never had a problem with until the ice caverns). My stomach churned the whole time, but I persisted for Uncle Fred! If you guys were to create a DLC or sequel, I would be the first to buy it and recommend it to everyone I know. Thank you to everyone involved in making this, you created an absolutely beautiful game.

original: Sid meier's civilization beyond earth is a turn-based game in which you build your civilization to a certain goal or 'victory'. In previous games you were set on the earth's timeline going through periods like the stone age, medieval age, and the modern age; however, in this game you are set in the future on a mission to colonize a new planet. What i enjoy about this game is 2k took a new approach to the game and added some new mechanics such as the affinity system and orbital layer. What i didn't enjoy was that with these new mechanics the game could be overwhelming at times. What think could be improved on this game is that they could maybe incorperate some new artwork in the game such as the enviroment you experience when communicating with another leader.
polished: Sid Meier's Civilization Beyond Earth is a turn-based game where you build your civilization to a certain goal or 'victory'. In previous games, you were set on the Earth's timeline, progressing through eras like the Stone Age, Medieval Age, and the Modern Age. In this game, you're set in the future, on a mission to colonize a new planet. What I enjoy about this game is that it took a new approach to the game, introducing mechanics such as the Affinity System and Orbital Layer. However, I didn't find it enjoyable that the new mechanics sometimes made the game overwhelming. To improve this game, I think they could incorporate some new artwork, such as the environment you experience when communicating with another leader.

original: Great game ! tons of replayability and very fun zombie survival game ! def. In my top 5 zombie games ever played. Edit: after playing 60+ hours i can honestly say this is one of the better more ''realistic'' zombie games. It's very much designed like a survival horror as you must save up your ammo, heal your own wounds when you bleed out, take pills when youre infected, etc. Also, i find zombies to feel very natual to be well animated for a free to play game. P.s. : i would recomend getting 1 or 2 friends to play with, but the community is super friendly and you can usually make friends/talk with the people in the chat or over voice comms.
polished: This game is a great experience, offering tons of replayability and immense fun as a zombie survival game. In my top five zombie games ever played, I can honestly say that this is one of the better, more realistic zombie games I've ever played. It's very much designed like a survival horror, as you must conserve your ammo, heal your own wounds when you're injured, take medication when you're infected, and so on. Additionally, I find the zombies to be very naturally animated, making them feel like a free-to-play game. I recommend playing with one or two friends, as the community is super friendly, and you can usually make friends or communicate with others in the chat or voice chat.

original: 02/07/2014 - it's a shame i can't thoroughly recommend/enjoy this game as from the short time i've played it,i know i'd be addicted if it didn't have the following 2 game breakers. . No aussie servers - one red bar puts you at a severe disadvantage,and creates unbearable lag. Mind you,i played through the offline training mode and it was stuttering/lagging as well (how does that even happen?). Couple that with the poor ping,and it just ruins the game. . Everything artifacts like crazy - the menu's,backgrounds,training and in-game. I've never had this happen before with this card and thought it might not like my oc. Set my gpu back to stock and sure enough,it didn't make a difference.
polished: Unfortunately, I cannot thoroughly recommend or enjoy this game due to the short time I've played it, as I know I would be addicted if it didn't have the following two game-breaking issues. Firstly, the lack of Australian servers puts players at a severe disadvantage, causing unbearable lag. Moreover, the offline training mode stuttered and lagged as well, which is astonishing. Additionally, the poor ping and lag ruin the game. Furthermore, the game's assets, such as the menus, backgrounds, and in-game graphics, are buggy and erratic. I've never experienced this level of lag with this graphics card before, and I thought it might not be compatible with my overclocked settings. However, setting my GPU back to stock settings did not resolve the issue.

original: Very late last night i finished this. The story is not very deep or interesting but what makes it stand out is the story-telling. The atmosphere is filled to the brim and the many collectibles do a great job at fleshing it out. I did learn a lot about the world of batman so it was a little disappointing that so few bosses were in the game. Oh well, there's enough future games to rectify that. The combat is the right amount of challenge but it's more on the easy side. Leveling up batman wasn't very satisfying. It's the gadgets you upgrade and acquire during the campaign which add for nice new gameplay mechanics. Getting access to previously unreachable places makes for a nice sense of progression.
polished: I recently completed the game, finishing it late last night. Although the story may not be particularly deep or captivating, the narrative shines through its engaging storytelling. The atmosphere is rich and immersive, with the many collectibles doing an excellent job of fleshing it out. I learned a lot about the world of Batman, which was a bit disappointing given the scarcity of boss battles. However, there are certainly more games in the future that will rectify this. The combat is moderately challenging, but leans towards the easier side. Leveling up Batman wasn't particularly satisfying, but the gadgets and upgrades you acquire during the campaign add a pleasant new layer of gameplay mechanics. Gaining access to previously inaccessible areas creates a sense of accomplishment and progression.

original: 'to the moon' is no mere game... Nay, it is a veritable experience, and it was one of the best of my life at that. Think telltale's the walking dead is sad? hohoho! well, it's no match for to the moon! never before have i been so depressed yet fulfilled over something purely fictional. This masterpiece represents the pinnacle of storytelling in my opinion, and the soundtrack is a gorgeously charming and perfect accompaniment. Yes, the controls are a bit finicky and the gameplay is not the strong point, but the story is so fantastic that i did not care one bit. Plus, the humor of the game is great as well and it definitely does not intrude upon the distinguished nature of the story... And the doctor who references are endless.
polished: To the moon is no mere game; nay, it's a veritable experience, and it was one of the best of my life at that. Telltale's The Walking Dead is sad? Ho ho ho! Well, it's no match for a trip to the moon! Never before have I been so depressed yet fulfilled over something purely fictional. This masterpiece represents the pinnacle of storytelling in my opinion, and the soundtrack is a gorgeously charming and perfect accompaniment. Yes, the controls are a bit finicky, and the gameplay is not the strong point, but the story is so fantastic that I did not care one bit. Plus, the humor is great, and it definitely doesn't intrude upon the distinguished nature of the story. And the references to the doctor are endless.

original: Bastion is a bloody brilliant game, with a really great storyline. Set after some calamity happened, you start to rebuild on the bastion. There's quite a lot of choice in the game, with the choice of what to build to give you an advantage, what weapons to use and what power ups to have on those weapons as well as what drinks to use to give you a bonus effect. The art style and music in the game is fantastic, everything looks so colourful at times, who says the apocolypse has to be dull. Best of all, the game has narration based on what you, the player do. So if you end up picking up a weapon then switch it for another in the armoury, the narration would say something of you taking along the new weapon.
polished: Bastion is a bloody brilliant game, boasting a rich and engaging storyline. Following a catastrophic event, you begin to rebuild within the bastion. The game offers a vast array of choices, allowing you to select the perfect combination of buildings, weapons, and power-ups to give you a strategic advantage. The art style and music in the game are both fantastic, creating a visually stunning experience that brings the apocalypse to life. Moreover, the game features a dynamic narration system, which responds to your actions in real-time. For instance, if you pick up a weapon and then switch to another in the armory, the narration will acknowledge your decision and adapt accordingly.

original: I had originally bought this game in early development, when the only currency was spacebux, and there was no 'tech tree'. This was when the game was good. All of the guns at this point were equally overpowered, so there was no problems with imbalance; everyone could kill everyone at any time. Also, the game used to give you unlimited gun slots and five loadouts. You would think that for a game with 'bajillions of guns', they would at least give you more than 6 weapon slots and 3 loadouts before you have to pay to get more. At one point, i had about 3 pages worth of guns, and was planning on new ideas for more, because personally, that's where i found it fun.
polished: I initially purchased this game during its early development phase, when the primary currency was spacebux and the tech tree was not yet established. At that time, the game was still in its early stages, and all the weapons were equally overpowered, which eliminated any balance issues; anyone could take out anyone at any moment. Additionally, the game used to provide unlimited gun slots and five loadouts. You might expect that a game with an extensive arsenal of 'bajillions of guns' would offer more than six weapon slots and three loadouts before requiring additional purchases. In reality, I had around three pages worth of guns and was planning on exploring more ideas for future additions, as I found the game's gunplay to be a significant source of enjoyment.

original: This game was a surprising gem. One often sees rave reviews of certain products that are often misleading. In this case, the reviews reflect the fun of this neat little game. It is an odd mix between a classic 2d platformer and an moba, and does it with style. I found myself enjoying characters that i wouldn't enjoy in other moba games. I had expected this trait to continue, but decided to give a melee tank a go anyway. I was pleasantly surprised with the outcome and ended up trying out more as they were unlocked from playing games. The art style and interface is oddly charming. As such, i now use one of the characters as my avatar and a wallpaper from creating a card set for the game.
polished: This game was a delightful surprise. I often come across rave reviews of certain products that are often misleading. In this case, the reviews reflect the fun of this charming little game. It's an intriguing blend between a classic 2D platformer and a MOBA, and it pulls it off with style. I found myself enjoying characters that I wouldn't typically enjoy in other MOBA games. I had expected this trait to continue, but decided to give a melee tank a try anyway. I was pleasantly surprised with the outcome and ended up trying out more as they were unlocked from playing games. The art style and interface is quaintly charming. As such, I now use one of the characters as my avatar and a wallpaper from creating a card set for the game.

original: I just started playing, but i love this game. I put on my headphone and lose myself in the game for hours at a time. It's been awhile since a game has had that effect on me. The music sets the mood, the sound effects are right on, and the controls are perfect. I look forward to every combat, and they've optimized combat extremely well. I had my doubt about the navel combat system, but it is so much fun to lay waste to multiple fleets at a time! the only way to lose in this game is to fail to retreat. If the combat looks overwhelming just get outta there, regroup, and counter-assault. Thanks, devs, for an awesome experience!
polished: I've just started playing, and I'm thoroughly enthralled by this game. I put on my headphones and become completely absorbed in the game for hours at a time. It's been a while since a game has had this level of impact on me. The music perfectly sets the mood, the sound effects are spot-on, and the controls are seamless. I eagerly anticipate every combat, and they've expertly optimized the combat to an extremely high level. I initially had doubts about the naval combat system, but it's surprisingly enjoyable to unleash destruction on multiple fleets at once! The only way to lose in this game is to fail to retreat. If the combat appears overwhelming, simply regroup, and counter-attack. Thank you to the developers for crafting an incredible gaming experience!

original: The reboot of the devil may cry franchise has brought about many changes for the series, particularly for series’ protagonist, dante. While fans of the original series may be upset at the change to their beloved character, it’s certainly for the better; and this new game by ninja theory proves it. Dmc serves as the perfect point for newcomers to jump into the series. It shows the origins of an arrogant, cynical dante, and it chronicles his journey from cynicism to selflessness. Throughout, the game weaves a clear, narrative arc for the new dante, making him a compelling character to watch.image the story follows dante as he’s introduced into the corrupt world he willfully chose to ignore.
polished: The reboot of the Devil May Cry franchise has brought about many changes for the series, particularly for its protagonist, Dante. While fans of the original series may be upset at the change to their beloved character, it's certainly for the better; and this new game by Ninja Theory proves it. The game serves as the perfect point for newcomers to jump into the series. It shows the origins of an arrogant, cynical Dante, and it chronicles his journey from cynicism to selflessness. Throughout, the game weaves a clear, narrative arc for the new Dante, making him a compelling character to watch. The story follows Dante as he's introduced into the corrupt world he willfully chose to ignore.

original: Where do i start on this absolutely beautiful game. It's story, is absolutely charming. It has so much detail put into it, and it is a bundle of happiness, bad puns, annoying dogs, secrets. It is serious when it needs to be, but isn't a stranger to funny moments. The character design is on point, with there being various characters with various personailities and secrets to them. It sticks out from other rpg's because you don't have to kill anyone, which is an unused concept in rpg's. With lots of inspiration from earthbound, one of the best rpg's i have seen, you can tell that it is going to be good. It easily has the best soundtrack i've heard in forever.
polished: Where do I start on this absolutely captivating game? Its story is absolutely charming, with a wealth of detail woven throughout. It's a bundle of joy, bad puns, and endearing characters, including annoying dogs and hidden secrets. While it tackles serious themes, it's not afraid to inject humor and lighthearted moments. The character design is spot on, with a diverse cast of characters each with their own distinct personalities and secrets. One of the standout features is the absence of combat, which sets it apart from other RPGs. Drawing inspiration from Earthbound, one of the best RPGs I've seen, it's clear that this game is going to be exceptional. The soundtrack is also one of the most memorable I've ever heard, and it's easy to see why.

original: I am recommending this solely because it's free, and might be a more 'enjoyable' experience for others. As for my experience, the 'game' did nothing for me. Half the story relies on shock factor. I was not shocked nor emotionally moved in any way by this. Maybe i'm desensitized, or maybe it was too simple to warrant a reaction out of me. As for the other half of the game, it tries to paint a picture (literally) of a person in mental decline. It deals with obsession, hallucination, depression and a few other things. In theory it is a cool idea. But the 'game' took me 10 minutes to complete, and that is with reading and taking in every little bit of information i could.
polished: I'm recommending this game solely because it's free, and it might provide a more enjoyable experience for others. As for my experience, the game didn't resonate with me. Half the story relies heavily on shock value. I wasn't shocked or emotionally moved in any way by this. Perhaps I'm desensitized, or maybe it was too simplistic to evoke a reaction from me. The other half of the game attempts to paint a vivid picture of a person's mental decline. It explores themes such as obsession, hallucinations, depression, and a few other issues. In theory, it's an intriguing concept. However, the game took me 10 minutes to complete, and that's with reading and digesting every piece of information I could absorb.

original: Do i even need to explain why portal is amazing? portal is a puzzle game, it gives you a concept then gets out. It is an amazing way to test your mind while still being fun. Although this game isn't as story heavy, it did give birth to one of the most good popular games of 2011. I still play this game and beat it when i am feeling bored and i love to come back and to see what gave birth to a legend and what is a legend. Gameplay: portal's gameplay is quite simple, to explain at least. You use portals to your advantage, along with buttons that activate a part of the puzzle. Two buttons are in the game, one that you press and one that you need a cube to put on.
polished: Do I even need to explain why Portal is amazing? Portal is a puzzle game that presents a concept and then gets out of your way. It's an engaging way to test your mind while still being fun. Although this game may not be as story-heavy as others, it gave birth to one of the most popular games of 2011. I still play this game when I'm feeling bored, and I love to come back and see what gave rise to a legend and what is a legend. Gameplay  Portal's gameplay is relatively simple, to explain at least. You use portals to your advantage, along with buttons that activate a part of the puzzle. Two buttons are in the game, one that you press and one that you need a cube to place on.

original: If you can overlook the bugs (which i personally only had two: one minor and the other quite annoying) edit: both bugs are resolved one fix increased my fps from 60-90 to 80-120 and are looking for a space exploration game, i can definitely recommend this. Since most of these reviews are about specs, i'll include mine: i5 6600k (~200€) radeon rx480 (~200€) z170 pro - gaming (~150€) 16gb ddr4 ram (~70€) ~650€ is definitely within the medium price range though, granted, this rig is quite new. Almost constant 60+ fps on high settings vsync enabled i genuinely can't believe 90% of the comments saying they're rocking an overkill setup and get 20fps.
polished: If you can overlook the minor bugs, which I personally only encountered two  one minor and the other quite annoying, the edit resolved both issues, resulting in a significant increase in my FPS from 60-90 to 80-120. If you're looking for a space exploration game, I can definitely recommend this. Since most of these reviews focus on specs, I'll include mine  i5-6600K, Radeon RX480 (~200€), Z170 Pro - Gaming (~150€), 16GB DDR4 RAM (~70€), and a total cost of ~650€, which is well within the medium price range. While this rig is relatively new, I can confidently say that I experienced almost constant 60+ FPS on high settings with vsync enabled, which is impressive, considering 90% of the comments claim to be rocking an overkill setup and only achieving 20 FPS.

original: Remember age of mythology? yeah, it's been that long since there's been an rts game of such quality. Divinity: dragon commander reaches awfully close to these borders of my personal most favourite rts game. Combine this with a huge risk-like grand strategy mode and there, it hit the spot. I am not (read: try not to be) overly biased due to the fact that this game allows you to turn into a dragon, aiding your troops by supporting, attacking and even commanding unit production, direction and spawning at the very same time. Honestly, i do like the complicated rts games nowadays. Think of civ v and so on. However, such games attempt to cram complex mechanics, charts and resources all into one complicated game mode.
polished: Remember the age of mythology? Indeed, it's been a while since there's been an RTS game of such high quality. Divinity  Dragon Commander comes close to the borders of my personal favorite RTS games. Combine this with a grand strategy mode and it hits the spot. I'm not (read  I'm not biased) overly enthusiastic due to the fact that this game allows you to transform into a dragon, supporting your troops by providing aid, attacking, and even commanding unit production, direction, and spawning simultaneously. Honestly, I do like the complex RTS games nowadays. Think of Civilization V and similar titles. However, such games often attempt to cram complex mechanics, charts, and resources into one intricate game mode.

original: Undertale comes together to make something greater than the sum of its parts. The graphics are solid for a retro title and the music is nice, but paired together they make some truly beautiful and impacting moments. The script runs the gammut from comedic to dramatic to heartbreaking to hopeful, sometimes all at once, and does this while turning rpg tropes on their head. And all of this without touching on the world, characters, story, gameplay... I could write whole pages about it. But instead, i'll just say this: if you like rpgs, play this game. If you like video games, play this game. If you have seven free hours between now and your death, play this game.
polished: Undertale comes together to create something greater than the sum of its parts. The graphics, a nod to the retro title, and the music, a perfect accompaniment, harmonize to create truly beautiful and impactful moments. The script effortlessly runs the gamut from comedic to dramatic to heart-wrenching to hopeful, sometimes all at once, and does this while subverting RPG tropes and turning them on their head. Without delving into the world, characters, story, or gameplay, I could write pages about it. But I'll keep it brief  if you're a fan of RPGs, play this game. If you're a gamer, play this game. If you have seven free hours between now and your mortality, take the time to play this game.

original: If you liked witcher 1 and 2, witcher 3 is must to get. I would give normally for this game 10/10 but unfortunatly after 1.03 this game turned into buggy ♥♥♥♥ + random crashes, so remember to save really often. When i played version 1.00 -> 1.03 my game never crashed, i didnt see any bugs. Also i have noticed that after 1.03 patch drawing distance sometimes is horrible, starting to draw objects when youre really close, sometimes even people. But if forgetting all these bugs, crashes and drawdistance 'bugs', this is really fantastic game, they made huge effort on quests, some of them really emotional and deep, lots of side quests, and the fact that your decision effects a lot in this game. I have played over 50 hours now and still going on.
polished: If you enjoyed Witcher 1 and 2, Witcher 3 is a must-have. I would normally give this game a 10/10, but unfortunately, after the 1.03 patch, the game became buggy, with frequent crashes. I recommend saving often. When I played the 1.00 to 1.03 version, I didn't experience any issues. However, I've noticed that after the 1.03 patch, the drawing distance sometimes becomes poor, causing objects to load when you're close up, and even people. While these bugs, crashes, and drawing issues are frustrating, I must admit that the game is still fantastic. The developers have put in a lot of effort into the quests, which are often emotional and deep, with many side quests. Moreover, your choices have a significant impact on the game. I've played over 50 hours and am still going strong.

original: I have only had this game for a few months, but in just that short amount of time, two dlc's have come out, along with patches that have made an already great game into an excellent one. The devs are very active in the community, and it really shows in the various discussion forums and dev diaries. There is a fairly steep learning curve to the game's mechanics of which i am still trying to learn; however, this breadth of strategy allows you a myriad of ways to reach goals and take advantage of certain situations. The game, in my mind, is almost infinitely replayable. I find myself sucked into every session i play regardless of how the play-through is going.
polished: I've had this game for only a few months, but in that short time, two DLCs have emerged, along with patches that have transformed an already excellent game into an even better one. The developers are extremely active in the community, which is evident in the various discussion forums and dev diaries. While there's a steep learning curve to the game's mechanics, I'm still learning, the breadth of strategy allows for a multitude of ways to achieve goals and capitalize on certain situations. In my opinion, the game is almost infinitely replayable, and I find myself fully immersed in every session I play, regardless of how the play-through goes.

original: Warframe is a fun game for the first few hours of play. After those few enjoyable hours you'll begin to see that the only thing left the game has to offer is repetition in it's combat, enemies and game play. The one major high point for the game is that the developers are working hard and do semi-frequent updates that generally include a lot of content from sweeping changes to some of the game's systems, new warframes and other tweaks/features. It's a good game to play casually. Though i doubt it will hold your attention beyond a few months unless you just really like grinding. The upside to all of this is that the game is free so i'd recommend trying it out. If you're looking for a quick fix, try it out.
polished: Warframe is an enjoyable game for the initial few hours of play. However, after those hours, you'll likely find that the game's offerings become repetitive, with the combat, enemies, and gameplay becoming the primary focus. The one notable highlight is that the developers are dedicated to regularly releasing updates, which often include significant changes, new Warframes, and other improvements. While it's a decent game to play casually, it may not hold your interest beyond a few months unless you're a dedicated grinder. On the plus side, the game is free, so I recommend giving it a try. If you're looking for a quick fix, it's definitely worth a shot.

original: This game is so.. Very.. Boring. I bought this game because i believed it was a pc version of 'katamari damacy', a popular and nice ps 2 game. Sadly it's far from it. In this game you go about, absorbing ever bigger things to grow bigger and absorb bigger things. But the gameplay isn't as smooth as it could be, the levels not inventive and what is in it is a surreal horror show. I don't mean an entertaining horror show but, one that makes you rather depressed and rethink whether being alive is all it should be. Every 'living' creature in this game from small pets to human beings makes me wonder if the creators of this game had an interest in taxidermy.
polished: This game is incredibly dull. I had high hopes for it, thinking it was a PC version of 'Katamari Damacy', a popular and enjoyable PS2 game. Unfortunately, it falls short of that standard. In this game, you collect and absorb increasingly larger objects to grow bigger and absorb even larger ones. However, the gameplay isn't as seamless as it could be, the levels lack creativity and the content is a surreal horror show. I don't mean an entertaining horror show, but one that leaves you feeling somewhat depressed and questioning the meaning of life. Every 'living' creature in this game, from small pets to human beings, raises the question of whether the creators of this game had an interest in taxidermy.

original: Alright. Let me explain a few things, as a person very intrested in politics, i was very interested in this game when i first heard about it. I thought, 'oh wow! a simulator of the road to becoming president! that sounds fun!' well, it really wasn't. The game starts you off and says you need to pick a side: republican or democrat, there is no independent, or third party. A little dissapointed, but still optimistic, i carried on to see what i could do. I will give the game credit, the character customization, although limited, is pretty fun to mess around with. It's the only time its an option to wear your head or not in a campaign. Literally.
polished: Alright, let me explain a few things. As someone deeply interested in politics, I was very intrigued when I first heard about this game. I thought, 'Oh wow, a simulator of the road to becoming president! That sounds fun!' Unfortunately, it wasn't as exciting as I expected. The game starts off by asking you to choose a side  Republican or Democrat, with no independent or third-party option. A bit disappointed, I still remained optimistic, so I continued to see what I could do. I will give the game credit, the character customization, although limited, is quite enjoyable to mess around with. It's the only time it's an option to wear your head or not in a campaign, literally.

original: Fallout 3 story was better. Settlements get in the way of the story to the point you'll hate baby sitting them instead of playing the story. Some keys are hard coded and cannot be rebound. Bugs galore. My pipboy disappeared permanently at one point and had to research console commands to get it back. You don't have to work for power armor it's basically given to you from the beginning of the game and power cores are everywhere in trader shops. Value of power armor diminished greatly from previous fallout games. Story is medicore, everything about this game is mediocre except it doesn't crash every 10 mins like fallout 3. Very stable compared to fallout 3. Is it better than fallout 3 no. Is it better than new vegas? no. This title was so overhyped for how bad it actually is.
polished: The Fallout 3 story is marred by the settlements, which can get in the way of the story, making it frustrating to play. Some keys are hard-coded and cannot be rebound. I experienced a frustrating issue where my Pip-Boy disappeared permanently, requiring me to research console commands to retrieve it. Unlike previous Fallout games, power armor is readily available from the beginning, and power cores can be found in trader shops. The value of power armor has decreased significantly from previous Fallout games. While the story is medicore, the game's stability is an improvement over Fallout 3, which would often crash every 10 minutes. However, it's not necessarily better than Fallout 3, nor is it better than New Vegas. The title was overhyped for its actual quality.

original: My stats (at the time of writing this review): - 8.6 hrs to get to the end - 10 collectibles found out of 25 - zero achievements out of 15 what i liked: - visuals up until the last level (ice caves) - story is not that great, but the ending (after the closing credits) kind of made me not regret so much spending my time playing this game what i disliked: - visuals in the last level are uninteresting - gameplay in the last level gets much harder making it become a frustrating experience of having to do a lot of things over and over again until you get it right - achievements are too hard. There are 13 (out of 15) that only less than 2,1% of players achieved!
polished: My stats (at the time of writing this review)  8.6 hours to reach the end, 10 collectibles found out of 25, zero achievements out of 15. What I liked  The visuals up until the last level (Ice Caves) were impressive. The story is not that great, but the ending (after the closing credits) left a somewhat positive impression, making me not regret the time I spent playing this game. What I disliked  The visuals in the last level were underwhelming, and the gameplay in the last level became frustrating due to the repetition of tasks, making it feel like I had to repeat the same actions multiple times before getting it right. Additionally, the achievements were too challenging, with only 2.1% of players achieving less than 13 out of 15.

original: Pros: +graphic cons: -bugs(especially the environment, you may get stuck or your shots may hit a invisible wall despite having clear line of sight of the enemy) -game is handholding/ babysitting you -dumb ai -enemies always seem to know where you are when you are spotted -godlike accuracy by the enemy which is frustrating like the first ghost warrior. -terrible checkpoints and saves. -boring story that i couldn't care less about will not recommend it unless its 90% off even then i find playing this game to be an extremely boring chore, just playing for the sake of finishing it to move unto the next game in my library. Considering the time i wasted on the first ghost warrior (which was equally boring and i feel liberated when i finished it), i probably won't play it until the end.
polished: Pros  +graphic Cons  -bugs (especially environmental, you may get stuck or your shots may hit an invisible wall, despite having a clear line of sight of the enemy) -handheld game babysitting -dumb AI -enemies always seem to know where you are when you're spotted -godlike accuracy by the enemy, which is frustrating, like the first Ghost Warrior. -terrible checkpoints and saves. -boring story that I couldn't care less about; I won't recommend it unless it's 90% off, even then I find playing this game to be an extremely boring chore, just playing for the sake of finishing it to move on to the next game in my library. Considering the time I wasted on the first Ghost Warrior (which was equally boring, and I feel liberated when I finished it), I probably won't play it until the end.

original: Review for 29/11/2015 do not buy this game, servers offline. You can't play. No compres este juego, servidores offline. No puedes jugar. While i could play it, i enjoyed it. To get all the cubes, you'll need to crack codes that you'll have to decipher. These can take a few seconds or frustrate you into looking into a guide. Overall, it's a fun and engaging game, but it can be challenging to get all the cubes and achievements.

original: It's not hard for me to see why other people like this game, but it wasn't for me. For one thing i have a vive and i'm much more interested in playing room sized games with the controllers. Beyond that, the game is initially awe inspiring in the scale of its universe, but i also felt that same scale was a hinderence to my enjoyment. The learning curve and the amount of time to do anything interesting at the beginning were both too large for me. Perhaps if i were more patient and had more time for gaming this would be compelling to me. But i don't have either and there are plenty more vr games i'd rather spend my time on.
polished: It's not difficult for me to see why others enjoy this game, but it wasn't for me. One reason is that I have a preference for larger-scale games and I'm more interested in playing games with controllers. Additionally, the game's vast universe is awe-inspiring, but I found that same scale hindered my enjoyment. The steep learning curve and the time it took to do anything engaging at the beginning were too great for me. Perhaps if I were more patient and had more time for gaming, this might have been more compelling. However, I don't have the luxury of time, and there are many other VR games I'd rather spend my time on.

original: Hands down my favorite first person shooter of all time. Run and gun rambos need not apply. Recoil and ballistics are realistic. Single hits to the chest, neck, or head from rifle caliber weapons almost always result in death unless it just grazes you. Rounds drop over distance and short, controlled bursts are required if you wish to remain on target. There is no magical ammunition pool. If you reload half-way through your magazine all the time then you will have a pouch full of half full mags. You can't run forever. If you sprint for a while your aim will suffer as you gasp heavily until you have caught your breath. Rest your weapon on your elbows while prone or on a window sill to steady your aim. Accuracy suffers when standing.
polished: My favorite first-person shooter of all time is a game that requires precision and strategy. Run-and-gun playstyles don't apply here. The recoil and ballistics are realistic, and single hits to the chest, neck, or head from rifle-caliber weapons usually result in death unless they just graze you. Rounds drop over distance and short, controlled bursts are necessary to remain on target. There's no magical ammunition pool, so it's crucial to conserve your shots. If you reload halfway through your magazine, you'll end up with a pouch full of half-full mags. You can't keep sprinting forever, as your aim will suffer if you're not careful. Take a moment to rest your weapon on your elbows while prone or on a window sill to steady your aim. In this game, accuracy suffers when standing.

original: Let me start off by saying i did not purchase eu when it first came out and that i got it on sale which included ew so i never experienced the issues that some people claim to have had with that game. I loved that game however, it was unforgiving in the early stages but rewarding when you did things right. As for xcom2 i love it, the game plays pretty well for me on medium and i am running a gtx560 with 2gb of vram. At first the game set it to high and it was running a bit sluggishly but not to the point of being unplayable but when i dropped it down to medium it smoothed on out. Not sure if i am just lucky when it comes to having issues with games or what but it seems that most of the negative reviews sound like they are coming from some really entitled people.
polished: I'd like to start by stating that I didn't purchase EU at its initial release and instead acquired it on sale, which included EU, so I never experienced the issues some users claimed to have encountered. I thoroughly enjoyed the game, although it was unforgiving in its early stages, but rewarding when I got things right. As for XCOM 2, I'm a big fan of it; the game runs smoothly on my medium settings with a GTX 560 and 2GB of VRAM. Initially, the game was set to high and it ran a bit sluggishly, but not to the point of being unplayable. However, when I dropped it down to medium, it smoothed out. I'm not sure if I'm just fortunate when it comes to encountering issues with games or what, but it seems that most of the negative reviews seem to be coming from some rather entitled individuals.

original: +rpg levelling +wide-variety of ship types +physics-based movement for both ships and projectiles/missles +easy-to-learn resource management +dark humored -grind intensive (if under utilizing the civvy station types) -sub-par ai teammates -low variety of equipment types -low variety of levelling skills (that is, no branching) listen, this game is fun as hell. Despite my minuses up there, there is still some variety and strategy to be had. It starts off fast and still really picks up. Even though there's a low variety of equipment, it still feels like there's always another ship to unlock or skill to level up. The best way to increase the life of this game is the mods. Fight for universe is easily the star, but big fight for beef is also very good.
polished: This game offers a wide variety of ship types, with physics-based movement for both ships and projectiles/missiles. It's easy to learn resource management, and the game has a dark humored, non-grindy feel, especially if you utilize the civvy station types. However, it's not without its drawbacks - the AI teammates can be subpar, and there's a limited variety of equipment types and leveling skills, which don't branch out. Despite these minuses, the game still offers some variety and strategy to be had. It starts off quickly and maintains a steady pace. Although there's a limited selection of equipment, it still feels like there's always another ship to unlock or skill to level up. To increase the game's longevity, mods are the way to go. The fight for universe is easily the star, but the big fight for beef is also very good.

original: World leaders gather to face uncertainty more than 2,000 business and political leaders from around the globe are arriving in the swiss mountain resort davos for the annual world economic forum (wef). For five days, they will discuss issues ranging from china's economic power to iraq's future after this sunday's elections. Uk prime minister tony blair and south african president thabo mbeki are among the more than 20 government leaders and heads of state leaders attending the meeting. Unlike previous years, protests against the wef are expected to be muted. Anti-globalisation campaigners have called off a demonstration planned for the weekend. The brazilian city of porto alegre will host the rival world social forum, timed to run in parallel with the wef's ritzier event in davos.
polished: World leaders are gathering in the Swiss mountain resort of Davos for the annual World Economic Forum (WEF). Over 2,000 business and political leaders from around the globe are arriving for a five-day meeting. The agenda will cover issues such as China's economic power and Iraq's future after this Sunday's elections. UK Prime Minister Tony Blair and South African President Thabo Mbeki are among the more than 20 government leaders and heads of state attending the meeting. Unlike previous years, protests against the WE Forum are expected to be muted. Anti-globalization campaigners have called off a demonstration planned for the weekend. The Brazilian city of Porto Alegre will host the rival World Social Forum, scheduled to run in parallel with the WE Forum's more exclusive event in Davos.

original: Deadline nears for fiat-gm deal fiat and general motors (gm) have until midnight on 1 february to settle a disagreement over a potential takeover. The deadline marks the point at which fiat will gain the right to sell its car division to gm, part of an alliance agreed in 2000. Gm, whose own european operations are losing money, no longer wants to own the unprofitable fiat unit. Reports of deadlocked talks sent fiat shares down 1.2% on tuesday, after monday's 4% gain on hopes of a payoff. The us firm is thought to be offering about $2bn (£1.06bn) to extricate itself from the arrangement. It has argued the deal was voided by fiat's decision to sell off fiat's finance arm and halve gm's stake via a capital-raising effort. The 2000 deal resulted from a race between gm and daimlerchrysler to ally with fiat.
polished: Deadline approaches for Fiat-GM deal  Fiat and General Motors (GM) have until midnight on February 1 to resolve their disagreement over a potential takeover. The deadline marks the point at which Fiat will gain the right to sell its car division to GM, part of an alliance agreed upon in 2000. GM, whose European operations are currently losing money, no longer wishes to own the unprofitable Fiat unit. Reports of stalled talks sent Fiat shares down 1.2% on Tuesday, following a 4% gain on Monday after hopes of a settlement. The US firm is reportedly offering around $2 billion (£1.06 billion) to extricate itself from the arrangement. It has argued that the deal was voided by Fiat's decision to sell off its finance arm and halve GM's stake through a capital-raising effort. The 2000 deal was the result of a race between GM and DaimlerChrysler to ally with Fiat.

original: Cardinal criticises iraq war cost billions of pounds spent on conflict in iraq and in the middle east should have been used to reduce poverty, cardinal cormac murphy-o'connor has said. The head of the catholic church in england and wales made the comments on bbc radio 4 and will re-iterate his stance in his christmas midnight mass. The cardinal used a christmas message to denounce the war in iraq as a "terrible" waste of money. He and the archbishop of canterbury have both spoken out about the war. Speaking on bbc radio 4's thought for the day slot, he criticised the fact that "billions" have been spent on war, instead of being used to bring people "out of dire poverty and malnourishment and disease". The cardinal said 2005 should be the year for campaigning to "make history poverty".
